page.title: 03RESERVOIR NEAR LIVINGSTON
page.content: The land for{Morton Reservoir}was acquired from the estate of Lord Morton.The original or{Upper Reservoir was constructed in{1886}and holds 8 million gallons of water and the top water level is 235.9m above sea level.This reservoir supplies water to the filter attendant's cottage with (raw) untreated water.The{Lower {Reservoir}was constructed in{1895}and extended after the second world war.This reservoir holds 88 million gallons and the top water level is 223.7m above sea level.This water goes through filter tanks and{chlorinated before flowing as the main water supply to{Ratho}village. Originally the reservoir supplied water to {Kirkliston,South Queensferry}and {Dalmeny.}This whole system is operated by one man Mr Hewitt who maintains the filters and chlorinates the water.
